fields.name: Course Level
fields.description: Course difficulty level (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, Professional)

fields.name: CEU Credits
fields.description: Number of Continuing Education Unit credits earned

fields.name: Course Duration
fields.description: Time required to complete course (e.g., '40 Hours', '3 Days')

fields.name: Learning Objectives
fields.description: Key learning outcomes separated by | character

fields.name: Standards Covered
fields.description: Industry standards addressed (e.g., 'ASTM F24, IAAPA Guidelines')

fields.name: Certification Type
fields.description: Type of certificate earned upon completion

fields.name: Intuto Course ID
fields.description: Unique identifier for course in Intuto platform

fields.name: Code Selling App Pool ID
fields.description: Identifier for token pool in Code Selling App

fields.name: Enrollment URL Template
fields.description: Intuto enrollment URL pattern with token placeholder

fields.name: Completion Webhook URL
fields.description: Webhook URL for course completion notifications

fields.name: Embed Player URL
fields.description: Base URL for embedded Intuto course player

fields.name: Course Completion Data
fields.description: JSON object storing course progress and completion status

fields.name: Intuto User ID
fields.description: Customer's unique identifier in Intuto system

setup_steps: 1. Go to Shopify Admin > Settings > Custom data
3. For each field above, click 'Add definition'
4. Enter the namespace, key, name, type, and description
6. Repeat for customer metafields in the 'Customers' section
7. Test by editing a product and ensuring metafields appear
validation_notes: Ensure namespace and key exactly match theme code
Test metafields display correctly in product templates
Verify customer metafields sync with Intuto completion data
Check that all required fields are marked appropriately
